title: Gary Gensler's Crypto Crackdown
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Gary Gensler's Crypto Crackdown.

hook.text: SEC Chair Gary Gensler called most crypto tokens securities and launched over 100 enforcement actions against crypto firms.

buildup.text: Gensler, a former MIT blockchain professor, argued existing securities laws already covered crypto. No new rules were needed.

discovery.text: His approach was 'regulation by enforcement.' Instead of writing clear rules, the SEC sued individual companies as examples.

twist.text: Courts began pushing back. Judges questioned whether the SEC was overstepping its authority on crypto regulation.

climax.text: Gensler's strategy created clarity through lawsuits but pushed innovation offshore. The industry demanded legislation.

punchline.text: A blockchain professor turned regulator who sued the industry he taught.

quiz.question: What was Gary Gensler's regulatory approach to crypto?
